summary: "Easy Rider" is a 1969 American road movie about two bikers traveling through the Southwest with money from a drug deal. Written and produced by Peter Fonda and directed by Dennis Hopper, it explores 1960s counterculture like the hippie movement and drug use. The film, featuring Jack Nicholson, was a big success, helping start the New Hollywood era. It made a lot of money and got good reviews, even getting two Academy Award nominations. It's now considered a very important movie in American history.
title: Easy Rider
